title: Problems with font- Unicode?
content:
It seems like I can never compile a font without incident. I have a recently pretty much finished with a typeface. Everything works fine in Adobe, but when I try using it in word, or previewing it in character map, I get what you see below. (just square boxes where there should be characters) I am pretty sure it has to do with the unicode encoding. What am I doing wrong? Thanks for any help you may provide.

I am using Fontlab 5 and windows XP.

 [‹ OSX: CT, Hinting?](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629050521/http:/typophile.com/node/18868 "Go to previous forum topic") [Value of fsType ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629050521/http:/typophile.com/node/18777 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Carni77

comments.content:
Sorry about the repeats. I kept getting a message, so I reloaded. My apologies for the spam. I am going to try attaching an image again in this message.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629050521im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fontlab-shot.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629050521im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Unxtitled-1.jpg)

You have to assign an unicode to your “non unicode” glyphs. Please use the Private Use Area (PUA) for this. (E000 - F8FF) If its done, you will find your “private” glyphs in word too.

— [astype.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629050521/http:/www.astype.de/)—

Thanks for the tip. However, my problem has to do with every single glyph showing up like this. I did try remapping the encoding using the PUA with standard, but honestly, I dont know what I am doing or why. Any other ideas?

Thanks,

JDooley
The screenshot of your FontLab windows looks okay: correct codepoints are assigned. In what format are you exporting the font? TTF, PS OTF, Type 1 PS?
Try exporting as a TTF and see if this makes any difference to be behaviour in Charmap and Word.
